meanings.definition: A person who samples food or drink to assess its quality.
meanings.sent1: The tasters at the event tried the different dishes to see which one they liked best.
meanings.sent2: The tasters at the competition had to judge the desserts based on taste and presentation.
meanings.sent3: The tasters were so picky that they could tell the difference between two types of salt!
meanings.sent4: Her tongue became a tasters' tool, discerning the subtle flavors in each bite.
meanings.sent5: The tasters' job was to savor every morsel and decide which dish was the most delicious.

meanings.definition: A small sample of food or drink used for testing.
meanings.sent1: She handed out tasters of the new ice cream flavor for everyone to try.
meanings.sent2: The bakery offered free tasters of their freshly baked bread to customers.
meanings.sent3: The tasters of the spicy sauce made everyone reach for a glass of water!
meanings.sent4: The tasters of the exotic fruit transported her to a tropical paradise.
meanings.sent5: The tasters of the soup were just enough to give a hint of its rich flavor.

meanings.definition: A device used to sample or test the quality of food or drink.
meanings.sent1: The electronic tasters in the lab could detect even the slightest impurities in the water.
meanings.sent2: The tasters in the kitchen were essential for ensuring the perfect balance of flavors.
meanings.sent3: The tasters malfunctioned and mistakenly labeled the coffee as decaf!
meanings.sent4: The tasters hummed softly as they analyzed the aroma of the wine.
meanings.sent5: The tasters beeped happily when the food met the set quality standards.
